title: Pierre's General Store Odoo
description: An Odoo 17 implementation for the Pierre's General Store of Stardew Valley videogame, including technical documentation and a custom backend theme made by me.

title: Multimode TicTacToe
description: A Tic Tac Toe videogame made with React Native as frontend and a provided backend made with Flask to support a multiplayer version using an API, http requests and handle responses with React hooks.

title: El Ahorcado
description: A hangman game made with PHP, with the goal of learn about Domain-Driven Design and some principles of PHP language.

title: Jukabox
description: This project is a full-stack app using Vue.js for the front-end and Django for the back-end, integrated with the MusicBrainz API to fetch and display music data like artists, albums, and tracks.

title: Just a game about a hungry crow
description: Video game featured in Godot Wild Jam #62, finishing with a score of #33 out of 103. Developed in the open source engine Godot v4.1.1 and programmed in GDscript (OOP language similar to Python).

title: Gameside
description: This project involves creating a custom API in Django without using Rest Framework, implementing custom serializers to handle requests and responses.

title: Lumino + LuminoDocs
description: This project uses Django to generate HTML, manage users from the backend, and send emails, with decoupled tasks to improve performance. Includes documentation generated using Material for Mkdocs.

title: Her Pretty Booklist
description: A list of books where you can mark those you already have or those you have pending to buy, powered by a Firebase database, you can add, mark or delete books from the web through HTTP requests with Typescript and Vue.

title: Shopping Cart
description: A project for the front-end development class: a video game shopping cart where you can add, remove, and purchase products. It uses tools like Vue and Firebase.

title: TRIBU
description: Compact social network developed in Django and Python as part of the evaluation of the Web Development in Server Environment subject.

title: Pokemon Shop
description: Front-end project for a Pokemon store, featuring a third-party API, HTTP requests, and Javascript and Firebase for authentication, login, and new user registration.

title: Post It!
description: 'ToDo' application, stylized as a Post-it note wall with CSS, for the Server-Side Web Development course.

title: SuperToDo
description: 'ToDo' web application developed in Django and styled with Bootstrap for the evaluation of the Web Development in Server Environment subject.

title: Legendex
description: Project for the Web Interface Design course: a gallery of champions from the video game League of Legends, displaying information about them extracted from a third-party API using HTTP requests.

title: JavaSpotify
description: Project for the web interface design course: a vinyl-style song player using CSS animations.
